intro: Dendrocnide luzonensis var. luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its stems and leaves contain potent irritants, causing a severe skin reaction upon contact. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
